int.label: Storage buckets, Cookies, Storage, and Cache
Client Hints, Cookies, Storage, and Cache
Client Hints, Storage buckets, and Cookies
Client Hints, Storage buckets, and Storage
Client Hints, Storage buckets, Cookies, and Storage
Client Hints, Storage buckets, and Cache
Client Hints, Storage buckets, Cookies and Cache
Client Hints, Storage buckets, Storage and Cache
Client Hints, Storage buckets, Cookies, Storage, and Cache
Blocked for lack of user activation
Approved due to existing storage access
Rejected due to missing sandbox token
Rejected due to a call being made from an invalid context
Approved due to being called from top-level frame
Approved with a new or existing grant

enum.name: SharedStorageHeaderObserverPermissionsPolicyDoubleCheckStatus
enum.int: The RenderFrameHost was null, so no double check was run. Any previous permissions policy checks were only done in the renderer, so this double check was required, and hence any operations were dropped.
The RenderFrameHost has not yet committed. Defer the operations until a corresponding commit notification is received. If none is received, they will be dropped when the RenderFrameHost dies.
The RenderFrameHost's LifecycleState is neither PendingCommit nor Active. We do not handle these cases as the PermissionsPolicy that we have access to may not be correct. Any operations are dropped.

The RenderFrameHost was non-null, but it had a null PermissionsPolicy, so no double check was run. Any previous PermissionsPolicy checks were done in the renderer, so this double check was required, and hence any operations were dropped.

The parent PermissionPolicy for the navigating RenderFrameHost was null, so no double check was run. The request source was an iframe navigation, which already has a PermissionsPolicy check in the browser process, however, so the double check was not required, and any operations were allowed to proceed, pending a user profile check.
The request source was a main frame navigation, which is not supported, so any operations were dropped.
The double check was run, and Shared Storage was reported as disabled for the request's origin. Any operations were dropped.
The double check was run, and Shared Storage was reported as enabled for the request's origin. Any operations were allowed to proceed, pending a user profile check.

enum.name: SharedStorageSelectUrlBudgetStatus
enum.int: The budget was not checked or an error occurred.

enum.name: SharedStorageWorkletDestroyedStatus
enum.int: Keep alive entered but reason for termination not given.

enum.name: SharedStorageWorkletErrorType
enum.int: Errors in `addModule()` or `createWorklet()` visible to the document.
Errors in `addModule()` not visible to the document.
Errors in `run()` visible to the document.
Errors in `run()` not visible to the document.
Errors in `selectURL()` visible to the document.
Errors in `selectURL()` not visible to the document.
Error in `addModule()` or `createWorklet()` not visible to the document: browser received message from renderer trying to create multiple worklets when "SharedStorageAPIM125" feature disabled.
Error in `addModule()` or `createWorklet()` not visible to the document: browser received message from renderer trying to cross-origin worklet when "SharedStorageAPIM125" feature disabled.
Error in `addModule()` or `createWorklet()` not visible to the document: cross-origin worklet cannot be created because shared storage is disabled for the origin's site.
Other errors in `addModule()` or `createWorklet()` not visible to the document.
Error in `run()` not visible to the document: browser received message from renderer with invalid context ID.
Error in `run()` not visible to the document: browser received message from renderer with keepAlive set to false.
Error in `run()` not visible to the document: cross-origin worklet operation cannot be completed because shared storage is disabled for the origin's site.
Error in `run()` not visible to the document: the module script hasn't been loaded.
Error in `run()` not visible to the document: cannot find operation name.
Error in `run()` not visible to the document: the operation definition instance was empty.
Error in `run()` not visible to the document: cannot deserialize data.
Error in `run()` not visible to the document: result of invoking script was empty.
Other errors in `run()` not visible to the document.
Error in `selectURL()` not visible to the document: browser received message from renderer with an invalid URL array length.
Error in `selectURL()` not visible to the document: browser received message from renderer with an invalid fenced frame URL.
Error in `selectURL()` not visible to the document: browser received message from renderer with an invalid reporting URL.
Error in `selectURL()` not visible to the document: browser received message from renderer with invalid context ID.
Error in `selectURL()` not visible to the document: browser received message from renderer with keepAlive set to false.
Error in `selectURL()` not visible to the document: cross-origin worklet operation cannot be completed because shared storage is disabled for the origin's site.
Error in `selectURL()` not visible to the document: the module script hasn't been loaded.
Error in `selectURL()` not visible to the document: cannot find operation name.
Error in `selectURL()` not visible to the document: the operation definition instance was empty.
Error in `selectURL()` not visible to the document: cannot deserialize data.
Error in `selectURL()` not visible to the document: result of invoking script was empty.
Error in `selectURL()` not visible to the document: promise did not resolve to an uint32 number.
Error in `selectURL()` not visible to the document: promise resolved to a number outside the length of the input urls.
Error in `selectURL()` not visible to the document: browser received message from renderer with unexpected index number returned.
Error in `selectURL()` not visible to the document: insufficient budget.
Other errors in `selectURL()` not visible to the document.
Error in `run()` not visible to the document: browser received message from renderer with invalid filtering ID byte size.
Error in `selectURL()` not visible to the document: browser received message from renderer with invalid filtering ID byte size.

enum.name: SqlRecoveryResult
enum.summary: Outcome of attempting to recover a database with sql::Recovery. See sql::Recovery::Result for descriptions.

enum.name: StorageAccessAPIRequestOutcome
enum.summary: Possible outcomes of a Storage Access API permission request.

int.label: Denied by missing prerequisite (user gesture, feature enabled)
Denied by top-level user interaction heuristic
Access was allowed through cookie settings
Access was denied through cookie settings
Allowed by requesting origin and embedding origin being same-site
Denied due to an abort by browser (e.g. RenderFrameHost was deleted)
Access grant used to allow access
Storage access allowed by force-allowed third-party-cookies (deprecated)
Storage access allowed by the top-level version of the API
Storage access allowed by 3PCD metadata grants content settings
Temporary storage access allowed by 3PCD heuristics
Storage access allowed due to CORS opt in
Storage access allowed by top-level 3PCD setting
The user clicked on the positive button.

enum.name: TopLevelStorageAccessRequestOutcome
enum.summary: Possible outcomes of a Top-Level Storage Access API permission request.

int.label: Denied by missing prerequisite (user gesture, feature enabled)
